channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Normality, factoriality and strong $F$-regularity of Lov\'asz-Saks-Schrijver rings
item.description: arXiv:2405.20480v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Every simple finite graph $G$ has an associated Lov\'asz-Saks-Schrijver ring $R_G(d)$ that is related to the $d$-dimensional orthogonal representations of $G$. The study of $R_G(d)$ lies at the intersection between algebraic geometry, commutative algebra and combinatorics. We find a link between algebraic properties such as normality, factoriality and strong $F$-regularity of $R_G(d)$ and combinatorial invariants of the graph $G$. In particular we prove that if $d \geq \text{pmd}(G)+k(G)$ then $R_G(d)$ is $F$-regular in finite characteristic and rational singularity in characteristic $0$ and furthermore if $d \geq \text{pmd}(G)+k(G)+1$ then $R_G(d)$ is UFD. Here $\text{pmd}(G)$ is the positive matching decomposition number of $G$ and $k(G)$ is its degeneracy number.
item.dc:creator: Eliana Tolosa-Villarreal

item.title: Componentwise linear ideals and exchange properties
item.description: arXiv:2405.20645v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove the componentwise linearity of ideals that satisfy a certain exchange property similar to polymatroidal ideals. We also discuss the componentwise linearity and exchange properties of ideals of $k$-covers of totally balanced weighted hypergraphs.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Asloob Qureshi, Somayeh Bandari

item.title: On unmixed and equi-dimensional associated graded rings
item.description: arXiv:2405.20647v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $(A,\mathfrak{m})$ be an analytically un-ramified Noetherian local ring of dimension $d \geq 1$, $I$ a regular $\mathfrak{m}$-primary ideal of $A$ and let $\overline{I}$ be integral closure ideal of $I$. If $A$ is of characteristic $p > 0$ then let $I^*$ denote the tight closure of $I$. Let $G_I(A)=\bigoplus_{n\geq 0}I^n/I^{n+1}$ be the associated graded ring of $A$ with respect to $I$. Assume $G_I(A)$ is unmixed and equi-dimensional. We show that either the function $P_{\overline{I}} :\,n\mapsto \lambda(\overline{I^n}/I^n)$ is a polynomial type of degree $d-1$ or $\overline{I^n}=I^n$ for all $n\geq 1.$ We prove an analogus result for the tight closure filtration if $A$ is of characteristic $p > 0$. When $A$ is generalized Cohen-Macaulay and $I$ is generated by standard system of parameters we give bounds for the first Hilbert coefficients of the integral closure filtration of $I$ and the tight closure filtration of $I$.
item.dc:creator: Tony J. Puthenpurakal, Samarendra Sahoo

item.title: Irrational components of the Hilbert scheme of points
item.description: arXiv:2405.11997v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We construct irrational irreducible components of the Hilbert scheme of points of affine n-dimensional space, for n at least 12. We start with irrational components of the Hilbert scheme of curves in P^3 and use methods developed by Jelisiejew to relate these to irreducible components of the Hilbert schemes of points of A^n. The result solves Problem XX of [J. Jelisiejew, Open problems in deformations of Artinian algebras, Hilbert schemes and around, arXiv:2307.08777, 2023].
item.dc:creator: Gavril Farkas, Rahul Pandharipande, Alessio Sammartano
